verse.verse_0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
verse.verse_1: The Hour came near and the moon was split.
verse.verse_2: And if they see any sign, they turn their faces and say this is magic perpetual.
verse.verse_3: And they belied and followed their desires, and every affair has already been resolved.
verse.verse_4: And undoubtedly, there have come to them those tidings wherein there was enough to check.
verse.verse_5: Perfect wisdom, but warners profit them not.
verse.verse_6: So turn you away from them. The day when the caller will call towards a harsh unrecognized thing.
verse.verse_7: Casting down their eyes, they will come out of the graves as they are locusts scattered.
verse.verse_8: Hastening towards the Caller. The infidels will say, 'this day is hard'.
verse.verse_9: The people of Nuh belied before them, they declared Our bondman to be liar and said, 'he is a madman and scolded him'.
verse.verse_10: He therefore prayed to his Lord, saying 'I am vanquished, do then take revenge for me.'
verse.verse_11: Then We opened the doors of heaven with forceful flowing water.
verse.verse_12: And We made the earth flow with springs so the two waters met to such a quantity which was already decreed.
verse.verse_13: And We bore Nuh on a thing of planks and nails.
verse.verse_14: Floating before Our eyes, a recompense for him who was rejected.
verse.verse_15: And We left it as a sign. Is there than anyone who would pay attention?
verse.verse_16: Therefore how was My torment and My warnings?
verse.verse_17: And verily, We have made Quran easy for remembering, is there than anyone to remember?
verse.verse_18: Aad belied, then how was My torment and My warnings?
verse.verse_19: Surely, We sent against them a strong windstorm in a day whose ill-fortune remained lasting over them.
verse.verse_20: It used to beat down the men as though they are the roots of uprooted palm trees.
verse.verse_21: Then how was My torment and My warning?
verse.verse_22: And undoubtedly, We made the Quran easy for remembering is there than anyone to remember.
verse.verse_24: And they said, 'shall we follow a man from among ourselves? Then we in deed are misled and mad.
verse.verse_25: Has the Reminder been sent down upon him from all among us? Nay, rather he is a great liar, self-boaster.'
verse.verse_26: Very soon, tomorrow they will know who was a big liar, self- boaster.
verse.verse_27: We are to send the she- camel for their trial, therefore O Saleh! Watch them and have patience.
verse.verse_28: And inform them that the water has been divided between them in shares. He who has his turn should be presented at the share.
verse.verse_29: Then they called their companion and he after taking the sword hamstrung her.
verse.verse_30: Then how was My torment and My warnings?
verse.verse_31: Verily We sent against them a single uproar, hence they became like the left over grass of enclosure builders, dry, trampled.
verse.verse_32: And verily, We made the Quran easy for remembering, is there than anyone to remember?
verse.verse_33: The people of Lut belied the Messengers.
verse.verse_34: Verily, We sent over them a storm of stones except the family of Lut. We rescued them by early dawn.
verse.verse_35: As a favor from Us. Thus do We recompense him who is grateful.
verse.verse_36: And he had warned them of Our grasp, but they doubted in the Commandments of warning.
verse.verse_37: They intended to solicit him from his guests, so We obliterated their eyes; 'taste My torment and My warning.'
verse.verse_38: And undoubtedly, there came upon them early in the morning a lasting torment.
verse.verse_39: Taste then My torment and My warning.
verse.verse_40: And undoubtedly, We made Quran easy for remembering. Is there than anyone to remember?
verse.verse_41: And verily the Messengers came to the people of Firawn (Pharaoh).
verse.verse_42: They belied all Our signs. Then We seized them with a grasp befitting to the dignity of the Honorable and the All Authoritative.
verse.verse_43: Are your infidels better than those? Or have you an exemption in the Scriptures?
verse.verse_44: Or is it that they say, 'We shall take revenge altogether.'
verse.verse_45: Now this multitude is being driven out and they will turn their backs.
verse.verse_46: Nay, rather the Hour is their promise and the Hour is the hardest and bitterest.
verse.verse_47: Surely, the culprits are misled and mad.
verse.verse_48: The day when they shall be dragged into the fire on their faces and it will be said to them, 'taste the flame of the Hell.
verse.verse_49: Undoubtedly, We created everything according to an estimate.
verse.verse_50: And Our work is only a matter as the twinkling of an eye.
verse.verse_51: And undoubtedly, We have destroyed your likes, is there anyone to look into?
verse.verse_52: And whatever they have done is in the Books.
verse.verse_53: And everything, small or big, has been written down.
verse.verse_54: Undoubtedly, the pious are in gardens and stream.
verse.verse_55: In the sitting of truth before the Sovereign, Most Authoritative.
